onset.Description: Position (latency) of event marker in seconds relative to the start.

duration.Description: Duration of the event. In this dataset, most of the duration values are arbitrarily set to 1.

sample.Description: Position (latency) of event marker relative to the start, in data frames.

Levels.contrastChangeB1_start: Start of contrast change detection block (run) 1
Levels.contrastChangeB2_start: Start of contrast change detection block (run) 2
Levels.contrastChangeB3_start: Start of contrast change detection block (run) 3
Levels.contrastTrial_start: Start of a single contrast change trial
Levels.right_target: The right-side leaning target was presented
Levels.left_target: The left-side leaning target was presented
Levels.right_buttonPress: The right mouse button was pressed
Levels.left_buttonPress: The left mouse button was pressed

event_code.Description: The original code used during data collection to indicate an event marker.

Levels.94: Start of contrast change detection block (run) 1
Levels.95: Start of contrast change detection block (run) 2
Levels.96: Start of contrast change detection block (run) 3
Levels.5: Start of a single contrast change trial
Levels.9: The right-side leaning target was presented
Levels.8: The left-side leaning target was presented
Levels.13: The right mouse button was pressed
Levels.12: The left mouse button was pressed

feedback.Description: The visual feedback the users recived to see if their resposne correct or not.

Levels.smiley_face: A green smiley face would show at the middle of the screen for 400 ms
Levels.sad_face: A red sad face would show at the middle of the screen for 400 ms
